kjv_def: hurt, injure, be an offender, be unjust, (do, suffer, take) wrong
strongs_def: to be unjust, i.e. (actively) do wrong (morally, socially or physically)
outline:
1. absolutely
    1. to act unjustly or wickedly, to sin,
    2. to be a criminal, to have violated the laws in some way
    3. to do wrong
    4. to do hurt
  2. transitively
    1. to do some wrong or sin in some respect
    2. to wrong some one, act wickedly towards him
    3. to hurt, damage, harm
